meanings.definition: The maximum extent of a vibration or oscillation, measured from the position of equilibrium.
meanings.sent1: The amplitude of the earthquake was so strong that it shook the entire building.
meanings.sent2: The sound wave's amplitude determined how loud the music was.
meanings.sent3: The bouncing ball had such a large amplitude that it almost hit the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with an amplitude that was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's excitement had an amplitude that energized the whole class.

meanings.definition: The magnitude of a wave or signal, typically measured from the baseline to the peak.
meanings.sent1: The ocean wave's amplitude was impressive as it crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent2: The radio signal's amplitude indicated the strength of the broadcast.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring had an amusingly loud amplitude that could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent4: The crowd's cheers rose to an amplitude that echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The storm's fury was evident in the amplitude of the lightning strikes.
